titleStmt.title: Practica Plutarche the excellent phylosopher
De tuenda sanitate praecepta. English. Selections
titleStmt.author: Plutarch.

editionStmt.edition: This text is an enriched version of the TCP digital transcription A67884 of text S104427 in the English Short Title Catalog (STC 20061.7). Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. The text has been tokenized and linguistically annotated with MorphAdorner. The annotation includes standard spellings that support the display of a text in a standardized format that preserves archaic forms ('loveth', 'seekest'). Textual changes aim at restoring the text the author or stationer meant to publish.

respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

fileDesc.extent: Approx. 8 KB of XML-encoded text transcribed from 7 1-bit group-IV TIFF page images.

publicationStmt.pubPlace: Evanston,IL, Notre Dame, IN, St. Louis, MO

availability.p: This keyboarded and encoded edition of the work described above is co-owned by the institutions providing financial support to the Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership. This Phase I text is available for reuse, according to the terms of Creative Commons 0 1.0 Universal . The text can be copied, modified, distributed and performed, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.

titleStmt.title: Practica Plutarche the excellent phylosopher
De tuenda sanitate praecepta. English. Selections
titleStmt.author: Plutarch.

notesStmt.note: Contains most of chapter 2 and the final prescriptions of "The governaunce of good helthe", a translation of: Plutarch. De tuenda sanitate praecepta--STC.
Imprint from colophon; publication date suggested by STC.
Identified as STC 20073 on UMI microfilm, reels 139 and 932.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
Appears at reels 139 and 932 (British Library copy).
